title: Authors and Citation
text: Oberman H, Vink G (2026). roundR: Round Numeric Values Nearest Integer. R package version 0.1.0.
code: @Manual{,   title = {roundR: Round Numeric Values to the Nearest Integer},   author = {Hanne Oberman and Gerko Vink},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.1.0}, }

what: Round Numeric Values to the Nearest Integer
title: Round Numeric Values to the Nearest Integer
text: goal roundR offer numeric rounding nearest integer, opposed [base::round()] default round nearest even integer.

title: Round Numeric Values to the Nearest Integer
text: can install development version roundR GitHub :

title: Round Numeric Values to the Nearest Integer
text: basic example shows solve common problem:
code: library(roundR) ## basic example code round(2.5) #> [1] 2 round_to_integer(2.5) #> [1] 3

what: roundR: Round Numeric Values to the Nearest Integer — roundR-package
title: roundR: Round Numeric Values to the Nearest Integer — roundR-package
text: default, R rounds numeric values even integers, following IEC 60559 standard. package offers alternative functionality round closest integer.

title: roundR: Round Numeric Values to the Nearest Integer — roundR-package
text: Maintainer: Hanne Oberman h..oberman@uu.nl Authors: Gerko Vink g.vink@uu.nl

what: Round to the nearest integer — round_to_integer
title: Round to the nearest integer — round_to_integer
text: base::round() function rounds number 1.5 2 number 2.5 also 2, IEC 60559 standard. function provides integer rounding alternative base::round().

title: Round to the nearest integer — round_to_integer
Round to the nearest integer — round_to_integer
text: x numeric element vector round nearest integer

title: Round to the nearest integer — round_to_integer
Round to the nearest integer — round_to_integer
text: Gerko Vink g.vink@uu.nl Hanne Oberman h..oberman@uu.nl

title: Round to the nearest integer — round_to_integer
code: library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: ‘dplyr’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’: #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’: #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union # unexpected rounding c(0.5, 1.5, 2.5, 3.5) |> round() #> [1] 0 2 2 4 # rounding to nearest integer c(0.5, 1.5, 2.5, 3.5) |> round_to_integer() #> [1] 1 2 3 4
